Nice find in the middle of no where neighbors BBQ: sometimes at these things I have to resort to the merlot.  It was some and creamy but no flavors that captured you..which is OK when it is 90!  Lacks meat...
Tough calling this a dunkel, well it is dark in color.  Some roasted malt aroma still kind of skunky.  Not much taste, on the whole kind of watery.  Pass

Toasted malt aroma with a very faint hint of raisin. The body is an dark amber/brown hue and holds a diminishing, but initially two fingers thick, tan head that leaves clingy lacing. Very light, watery fore that tastes of steeped grains and stewed raisins with a hint of caramel. Extremely clean and smooth with low carbonation. None of the normal lager carbonation crispness. Quite decent on the whole.
Beef, grain, and skunk aroma. Cola colored with a thin bubbly head. Wheat toast flavor, with a complimenting skunkiness. Vanilla and plum finish and some hops. Thin mouthfeel.
Much better dunkels out there.  Don’t go with a mass production company for a good dunkel.  Good attempt though, with some rich character malty flavors

Drank from the neighbors cooler. I thought this would be worse then it was. Dark brown pour with barely any aroma. After sniffing for 5 minutes , I did detect some hop. A mild coffee and malt taste but with a water feel. It was ok.

Rated 11/9/06:  Basic euro dunkel, rather drinkable but somewhat boring. Faint aroma, lightly skunked but cut with some decent caramel malt. Average pour. Light and crisp, finish is a touch too bitter. Flavor is alright at best, not too much to explain.
Drank on tap. Dark amber with little to no head. Weak watery flavors, but drinkable nonetheless.

Bottle.  Pour is a dark brown which you can just barely see through when held to the light.  Prominent roasted barley nose.  Good roasty taste too, and even though it finishes crisply like a lager, there is still at least a touch of a pleasant malty aftertone.  Not bad for a dark lager, and I certainly prefer it to regular Beck’s.
24oz. real dark ebony almost purplish color. tasted of roasted Crayola’s. bitter finish
24 oz. Very tasty for a dark lager. I am not big on dark lager’s, but this was very nice. Poured a complex light black, decent froth, complex flavor that’s non-existint in guiness.
The best thing i can say about this beer is that where i buy this, it is always on sale. Not a great beer but it does have an alright flavor for the price.

Having this one on draft at Bodega Brew Pub downtown La Crosse, Wisconsin USA. Poured with a big foamy frothy head and lots of lace. Dark brown color with dark cherry highlights. Mildly roasty malty aroma. Very smooth, malty, a hint of sweetness, roastiness, yet a bit dry too in the finish. Very drinkable. Definite session beer.

Pours coffee amber w/ a medium sized, spritzy froth. Hang time is minimal w/ a fine ring of residual brewers lace. Aroma of slightly roasted, brisk malts. Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. A malty brew w/ a mild roast component. Theres a defined bittering that makes this brew drinkable. Not many distinguishable flavors though. The finish has a velvet bittering component.

Not bad for a green bottled beer, but it still has just a hint of that green bottle funk.  It has a bit of a roasted flavor, with no real hint of hops.  Pours an orange-like color, and goes down very smooth.

Well, this is not a twist off, ouch!  12 oz bottle with a gold foil brazier. I recognize this as one of my better pre rater beers. Pop the lid, after I find and opener, and get a slight veggie cabbage aroma. Wow, once poured it has an aroma of no other.  It is almost like licorice or anisette or something. Tannish ring for a bantam head. That smell is really something!  First flavor hints are definitely what I would refer to as ‘dark’.  Flavor is not hoppy by any means. It has a laid back roastyness that imparts a distinct dark flavor without a medicinal quality. Nice gentle finish and a decent amount of carbonation. No terrible linger with the last drink. This is a benefit if you don’t care for bitter beers.

Pours a very dark amber with a small off white head. Not getting much from the aroma. Light malts and touches of chocolate and sort of a metallic smell. Flavor is sweet malts, light hops and hints of roasted nuts.
beck’s best. a little bit sweeter, thicker and fuller than the original, goes down smooth.
Kinda sweet with a hint of vegetal notes.  Not  bad.  Seems underrated as a dunkel, as it is not a bad representative of the style, even if it is lacking interest.

24 ounce bottle, 4.8% a/v

Pours a dark chocolate/cola brown with a thin offwhite head. Smells of malt, chocolate and a wee bit of hops. The taste is malty and rich with caramel/chocolate notes. The aftertaste is minimal with some hop bitterness. Not a bad beer. Nothing overly special either.

Bomber. Pours a clear dark orange amber with a fading off white head. Aroma of noble hops and caramel, maybe a touch of smoke. Medium body an moderate carbonation. Nutty caramel and honey taste with a grainy quality that I don’t favor. Dry and somewhat bitter finish.

Bottle, pasteurised, 330ml. Dark brown with faint head, carbonated. A pre trip bottle of dark lager, what more could I want, well one that doesn’t taste of cardboard for one, a beer with more flavour would be nice. Some sweetish fruitiness and a hint of bittering dark malt. Pretty average.
Bottle. Pours dark with brown head. Head doesnt last long. Aroma has a small coffee smell. Didn’t get skunky like others say. had expected more and there are others i would rather drink.

Pours a dark chocolate brown, with a short lived head that leaves behind a creamy ring and a light film. Aroma is a sour skunky smell. Taste is of waterd down malts, with light hints of chocolate, this beer didn’t really have any kind of bullocks. Robust flavor my foot. Very one dimensional. Will not buy again.
Was expecting more from this beer.   Not as much malt flavour as I was expecting.  Lacked flavour overall.
I really didn’t like this beer. The smell was sour, the taste was watery and left a nasty aftertaste.

From the tap, served in your basic bar pilsener glass.

Poured a clear cola brown with a creamy, fluffy head that settled into a lightly sudsy lacing.

Aromas of spicy brown bread and roasted grain malts with a earthy hoppiness.

Good, steady carbonation and a malty crisp, dry, smooth medium-light bodied mouthfeel.

Nice malty taste, not exceptional, but pleasant, bread grainy, husky, roasted malt sugary, a very light hop bite towards the end, and a dry grainy, malty finish.

I hadn’t seen this on tap in awhile, so I thought I would give it a try, not bad, hit the spot at lunchtime.
Pours a dark brown from the bottle with a slightly-off white head which reduces to a thin lacing around the glass.  Aroma of sweet malts.  Taste of malt, little hops.  Decent with a German meal.

This wasn’t all that bad, needed something cheap to go with my chinese food so what the hell. Rather nice toasty melted caramel malt taste. Very clean in the finish, no really awful taste like some of the other similar cheap dark beers. Light smoked character develops a bit, still thin tasting, but I was anticipating much worse.
Bottle; Nose is sugary malt with some citrus hop notes; color is that of cherrywood with a small straw colored head; flavor is semi-sweet roasty-smoky maltwith some mild hop notes.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a nice creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel and bit of chocolate. Flavour is smooth and malty, caramel and toffee, some chocolate, little fruitiness.

I enjoyed this beer.  The pour is an attractive dark brown with plenty of ruby highlights.  The head is off-white and average to above average.  Little if any lacing.  The aroma is citrus fruits with some hoppiness.  The flavor comes through with citrus fruit, and a bit of brown sugar with a lightly hoppy finish.  Thin, watery mouthfeel but a decent dunkel nonetheless.

Brew poured a dark brown  with a fizzy brown head.  Fair Lace.  Nose of chocolate, sweat, toffee, and brown sugar.  Taste of caramel, pine and saw dust.  Watery and metallic.  Nice session easy to drink but lacks substance.

Bottle:  Dark, but somewhat transparent color with an amber tint.  Decent off white head.  Water, bread, chlorine in the nose.  Very wear flavor, body and finish.  Hops are over done, which isn’t hard due to the apparent lack of malt or alcohol... This beer does not have a single attribute of the style. Yeah... can’t recommend to anyone...

Pours very dark brown with a small fizzy tan head. Aroma is lightly sweet, with notes of chocolate and some nuttiness. Flavor is basically your average becks with some roasty chocolate malts added. Palate is thin, and the finish is quick. Not really better or worse than the original becks, but nothing special.
Blah.  Not as good as I would have expected.  It frankly tasted a little burned, and not in a good way.  Too bitter, too, so there was just too much going on.  Just not very good.

Better than your average.  Great dark beer for those willing to step into the next level of beer sampling.  Macro-Import-This... the third level, perhaps?  Highly drinkable and will turn heads amongst the Macro drinkers.  Now if this was only considered the macro and not Miller lite?
i don’t know why this is rated so weakly. for me it defeats 2 beers in the 80th percentile

Bottle.  Brown sugar malt aroma with metallic aroma coming out more as it warms.  Cloudy medium brown with small head.  Brown sugar and malt flavor with metaliic taste and moderate hops finish.   Metallic taste messes this beer up - otherwise would have been decent.
pours a dark brown with large foamy head .kinda skunky aroma ,and taste is preety much the same .but hey better than most macro crap
Rich dark brown color is misleading for this bland beer. Main flavor is sweetness.

I love a good dunkel, and this doesn’t even come close! This comes off more like a dark lager-- it has a nice dark colour, but that is about as much character as you’ll find in this beer. For mass-produced dunkel, Warsteiner is better, but that ain’t saying much!
12oz bottle-A dark amber in body with an off white head. An aroma of grain, corn, and a liitle malt. Taste of malt, a little sweetness, and mild bitterness. Ok
Bottle. Very dark color with light brown head. Malty and slightly sweet flavor. Although made by the same brewery I don’t like this as much as the St. Pauli Girl special dark. Still not bad.

Broke my rule against drinking beer in green bottles and bought a Becks Dark. Familiar green bottle skunky smell and flavor. Slightly warmer matly flavor than orginal Becks but sour flavor over-powers everything

Bottle. Green bottle, unfortunately, without secondary packaging, so there’s a whiff of skunk as soon as it’s opened. Otherwise decent, but nothing too special; a hint of bitterness, a bit of roated malt, some sweetness.
Excellent dark beer.  Very deep brown color and somewhat malty flavor.  It has a bold flavor, though it’s not as bitter as its light counterpart.

bottle.  Pours a deep clear brown- more of a deep ruby red, and an off white- almost greyish beige head and some lace.  Aroma is toasted and bready malts with hints of caramel, and light herbal hops.  Light flavor but more toasted malts, light munich bready and slightly nutty.  Smooth but the body is pretty weak.  Nice clean hoppy bitterness in the end.  Too weak but otherwise a decent dunkel.

A good looking brew, I’ll give it that. Ebony and caramel to look at with a nose of barley and caramel. A bit sweet for me, and without much in the way of complexity. The barley is watered dowm by the brewer’s attempt to bastardize a dark and a lager together. A rather watery finish, which makes this a decent brew with salty foods, but nothing to get worked up about.
A good tating beer. Clean taste. Mild Aroma . Lousy palate. Not that bad, but not that great.
Some pretty good beer. A little more expensive but definately a step up from the run ofthe mill Budmillercoors fare.

Bottle from beerhandy. This one pours deep chestnut, with a mocha head fluffing up for only a minute. Aromas of faint milk chocolate, roasted coffee beans, and smoke. Earthy chocolate flavours are influenced by a gush of water, which dumbs down the taste. FInishes without  a trace. A dark beer for people who don’t like dark beers.
Dark pour, aroma is a bit on the sour side.  Taste is passable, but not very good.   I haven’t had a regular becks in awhile, but this can’t be much better.
Bottle. Pours clear dark red brown, off white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, and skunk. Flavor is malt, caramel, and molases, but it’s also a bit skunky too.
I liked this beer.  Better than the original!  This is a great dark German beer.  Will be a once a year six pack for me!

From 12oz Bottle, expiration date 01/2005.  Deep brown pour of chocolatey molasses, topped with a decent layer of bubbly tan head.  Soft, supple aromas of raisin, chocolate, and some lightly toasted malts.  This one smells much silkier and fruitier than fresh versions I’ve had.  Full bodied, lightly carbonated, creamy mouthfeel.  Flavors of chocolate milk and raisins with a mild sprinkle of almonds.  Some of the more roasted flavors seem to have diminished from what I remember.  Not bad overall - I’m surprised this one held up as well as it did, and in some ways even improved my impression over younger versions I’ve had.
Blackish pour with 2-finger tan head.  Aroma of roasty malt, nuts, some chocoff.  Tastes roasty malty, with slight chocolate syrup notes as it warms.
I found this much better than the regular, but nothing special.  I prefer porters or stouts to dark lagers, but this isnt bad.

Bottle. Pours out dark brown-molasses colour with a fizzy tan head. Scent is malty accompanied by a grain and skunky hop scent on the backdrop. Taste is skunky hops, maltiness, and lightly roasted maltiness. Leaves an astringent tap water sharpness on the palate but goes down well after it dissapates.
Dark brown beer with an average head. Smells a tad skunky. Mild aroma of caramel malts. Taste of carbonated caramel malt. Not much flavor. Eeeh, an ok beer.
Bottle.  Better than the light, but not much.  Brown pour with small head.  Malty nose, and somewhat sweet.  Palate is OK, and finish is decent.
A bit of maltiness that adds a little complexity to the lager style.  A crisp beer that can act as your goto when your at your in a macro situation...
(Tap) Pours dark brown with not much head. Malty sweetness abounds. Not much in the way of balance. Watery palate. Not as good as the regular Becks.
Aug. 4, 2006; 12 oz. bottle.  Heartier than expected, in spite of the sour aroma; nice color & malty palate.  Not bad at all.

Pours a nice medium brown with a small tan head.  The aroma doesn’t match the color - grain and sours.  Taste is more of a malt and hops duet.  No dominate flavor or intensity whatsoever.  Pretty boring overall.

I like the dark lagers, my favorite restuarant in college served a dark lager and had a TV, which my apartment did not. Association with pleasant times must have influence. This is not really sweet by typical Schwarzbier style. More of a roast than a caramel maltyness. A little German bite to the hops, I didn’t notice the metallic aftertaste, was just a clean finish for me. I found it refreshing but a bit thin. I can enjoy this, would be even more a frequent order if I could find it on tap.
pours out watery brown.  not impressed with the lack of any flavor.  At least it didn’t have a skunky tast like other macro beers.
Cold 12oz bottle:  Dark brown in color with virtually no head.  Taste is toasted molasses with some bitterness. Metallic aftertaste.  Regular Becks is better.

Pours cola-esque into the glass.  Mine had almost no head nor lacing.  Aromas are somewhat sour and hops.  The body of this beer grows/builds through the finish, as initial flavors are a bit dry.  I pick up lightly roasted notes, with increasing bitterness.  Hops continue in the finish even after the pull has concluded.  Honestly, since the brew doesn’t come to fruition until much later, the body initially feel thin, due to a (possible) overcarbonated, watery contingency.  Thus, this leaves a highly mediocre impression.  Not terrible, but overall, just middle of the road.
not as good a regular becks. same style of crisp and clean finishes, a bit more hearty and malty but not much else. i’ll stick with the regular

Poured a dark brown color with a nice, almost a bit fluffy, head (reminded me of a Smithwick’s pour). Aroma was of caramel and some sweet malts. The flavor followed suit, caramel-like malts, maybe some bubblegum, with a dry finish and overall mouthfeel. Pretty drinkable, but not my favorite style (pretty boring).
Bottle: A dark beer with average hoppiness, medium bitterness, a decent, average, drinkable beer.
24oz bottle... light carbonation...but not in a smooth way...more like flat.  Has the usual metallic becks aftertaste...decent but prefer heineken dark

12 oz bottlle best before 05/ 06. just in time.


clearish dark brown with a short lived tan head.

aroma is slightly malty, roasty, brown sugar.


Flavor is sweet and slightly roasty.


dry metalic finish dtracts from the overall experience.

I think this complements normal becks very well. If you like becks, then you should really like this. it has a metallic aroma and after taste to it. It had a medium brownish head that didn’t last long, it seemed to pour real carbonated but went kinda flat right away. it taste just like becks If you were to ad some sugary syrup to it. Certainly not the best beer around.. but I enjoy them every time.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & tupalev -- courtesy of tupalev. Pours a clear dark orange-brown with a spare diminishing tan head. Aroma of the regular Becks with lots of sugary malt added. Flavour of sweet malt, sugar and a bit of a metallic aftertaste. Light to medium bodied. This isn’t very good.

Bottle shared with GregClow, Blankboy, Jerc, and Hogtown Harry, courtesy of me.  Sugary malty aroma with some metallic edge to it.  Nice golden dark brown colour, small oily white head.  Interesting sweet malt taste on a rather light body.  Brown sugar and maybe roast?  Even a bit smoky.  Too bad about the metallic edge in the flavour too.  Not quite sure what to make of it, but it was interesting enough!

Bottle (12oz).  Shared with blankboy, GregClow, jerc and tupalev - tupalev’s bottle.  I confess - I don’t like Becks regular.  But anyway.  Poured clear deep ruby-mahogany with a small off-white diminishing head.  Sweet brown sugar malt aroma, a bit vegetal and metallic (like regular bottled Becks), with faint dried flower hop character. Taste of dry, dusty sugary light roast malt and a nasty bitter-metallic aftertaste. Average body, slightly flat mouthfeel, the aftertaste sticks around way too long.  On reflection I didn’t find the whole as bad as the sum of the parts.  Less metal and it’s a 3.

Bottle. Brown body with a small beige head. Very muted, sugary malt aroma with light notes of something odd, slightly metallic. Sweet caramel malt flavour is fairly dilute. Light bite in the finish. Average to thin palate. Meh.

Bottle shared with blankboy, jerc, HogTownHarry & tupalev - courtesy of tupalev. Dark ruby with a thin tan head. Aroma is very sweet and slightly artificial, with a very faint skunkiness - kind of like regular Becks mixed with cola. Body is on the thin side, not a lot of carbonation. Flavour isn’t awful, but somewhat bland. Some sweetness off the top, a bit of tobacco and smoke in the middle, and a moderately dry finish. A decent mainstream dark, I guess.

Absolutely terrible.  I’m curious if I’m tasting what is bottled, or if this is a result of shelf life and oversea transport, because the putrid vegetable and plastic flavors found in this one are absolute horrible.  Color is a medium dark ruby brown, head is medium sized and sustained, but that’s where the praise ends.  Smells and tastes of acetone, stale cigarette smoke and old sharp moldy vegetables and pasty yeast.  Actually has a significant bitterness, but not anything redeeming.  An abortion of a beer.

I like Becks Dark for the availability level of dark beers - esp. in rural areas.  It’s on the lighter end of darks.  I like the malt taste of this dark beer.  The head could stand much improvement, but it’s still a fine beer.
Essentially, it’s a darker less pleasant versino of regular Becks, which is about average to begin with.  It’s passable, but not something I’d look for.
this brew made me feel like i had a top hat filled with candy but i dont even wear top hats.

Bottle. Dark brown body with heavy carbonation and average off-white bubbly head. Its malty/hoppy aroma lacks complexity and carries some light roasty notes. Taste is slightly dominated by hoppiness and ends with a decent bitter finish. Not bad.
Bottle.  I found this to be a lot better than regular Becks.  Eh, not a very strong malt taste, but pretty sweet.
Had this in Huntsville, AL.  This tastes more like a schwarz beer then a Dunkel.  I don’t think this beer is very malty.  It has malt but it is not a strong malt taste.  It’s very smooth.

bottle - Pours dark brown with a thin head that soon fades to nothing.  The aroma is of roast malt and I think a touch of hops.  The flavor is quite malty with fairly well balanced hops and not much else going on.  The palate is fizzy and too thin.  The finish is rather sweet.  It’s not a bad beer, but not as good as it should be.
Pours dark ruby with a mostly receding tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toasted graininess. Mouthfeel is thin to medium bodied with lively carbonation. Not a bad beer, but totally forgetable.

Deep red appearance with a tiny head and no appreciable lacing.  Malty aroma with a hint of roastiness.  Very simple flavors with a  cardboard-like taste.  Sweetish finish lasted longer than it should have.
Aroma of artificial molasses, caramel, some roasted notes.  Appears a mahogany color with no head to speak of.  Flavor has some molasses.  Palate is medium thin.

Hmmm . . .what a refreshing glass of oddly waxy and badly scented water.  Oh - it was a beer you say?  Oh, well in that case it wasn’t very good.  Not bad for water.  But a rather flat, oddly waxy, and completely unremarkable beer.
This beer offers an aroma of sour dates.  It is dark brown in color and offers no head.  It is a thin liquid that has a fast fading taste of sour wheat and mild nuts.
This one’s not too shabby. I’ll grab one of these at the corner store every now and again. Tastes better than you’d think.

The dark color seems to indicate a flavor much fuller than advertised.  Head is light and disappears quickly.  The palate is short for a darker beer, not to say a short palate is always but in a dark beer I expect it to be longer. Im drunk.

Drank this one from the bottle so I didn’t get to see that much.  This ones one of those, let’s pick something I haven’t had before.  I’m not sure I agree with the commercial description but, it’s not that far off.

Pours a clear, thin-mahogany with a creamy, ecru head that lasts awhile. Aromas start with light chocolate and roast grain, but adversities creep in with nut shells, chemical smoke, new carpet and pencil shavings. Malts are husky without sweetness; hops are bitter yet tinny. Everything necessary for a quality dunkel is here, but it seems to be assembled incorrectly. 


"Super Size" 24 oz. bottle from Bridgeview Liquors, Bridgeview, IL 60455

12 oz. bottle, Best Before date of 4/06, purchased by a friend of mine for my 30th birthday...Pours a flat ruby brown with a small, diminishing creamy sponge-like head...Smell some heavy roasted malts, maybe even some molasses and burnt apple with some light hops in the distance...Medium body, thin and creamy texture, and surprisingly soft carbonation. A semi-bitter metallic finish...Long in flavor, lightly sweet with big undertones of bitterness...Overall, decent enough and could be quite good if it wasn’t as watery though.  Definitely improves as it warms.  Would never be my beer of choice, but I could drink a few down if should the mood strike me.
Bottle.  It’s really good but I have only had off the shelf, widely avaible beer.  It is a little bitter on the finish when warm.  Often the best choice in a resturant.
Slight roasted maltiness apparent...a step up from regular Becks...but not a lot going on here.   Lager yeast fairly easy to pick out.  Refreshing if that’s my only choice.
Bottle Dark brown with a slim, soon gone head. Sweet and disappointing taste. Rheinheitsgebot can guarantee absolutely bugger all.
12 oz bottle.  Not bad, considering the bar maid didn’t give a glass.  Pretty smooth.
Not nearly as bad as the original, but not as good as Heine Dark.  Good for drinking in the fall when the leaves are changing.
drunk from bottle: skunky smelling, flavor is simalarly skunky with some roasted malt taste, pretty thin.  Wouldn’t buy again

Brown pour, moderate off white head.  Sour, malty, slight roast aroma.  Flavor is better.  More of the slight roast and malty, very simple.  Easy to drink, but that’s cuz it’s kinda thin.  Not particularly sastisfying.
Pours a medium brown.  Aromas of wheat bread, caramel, and a touch of something metallic.  Flavor is malty/metallic without a lot of character.

Very earthy, and mildly hoppy - nonle, not as bitter. Nothing floral. Pours nice tan head. The color is translucent, but not watery. Nice, nutty flavor. Not a usual dunkel, but this is cheap - so tastes like a heavy, low-fizz summer Bock. Good, full palte taste; could use some bitterness or adjucnt flavors to offset how thin it is to make the swallow and aftertaste less lagerish. All in all, the best Becks beer you can get easily in the States.
a very underwhelming dunkel from beck, the favorite german beer in america...  metallic aroma, dark colored and no head, it is indeed a very interesting combination.

Poured a dark reddish/brown color with an averaged sized off white head. Aroma of initial grassiness that turned to a rotten vegetable smell with some caramel.  Tastes of light grass, light caramel, and roasted malts. Lively but thin body. Boring.

Pours a deep black with a nice chocolate head.   Smells of dark malts and grains.  Tastes similar but is much fainter.  There really isn’t much to the taste but it is smooth.  A very nice beer to drink if you want to have a few without getting real filled up.
Very nice dark color.  Nothing special in the realm of taste, but goes down smooth.  A consistent, decent, very drinkable, dark beer.
Pours out a nice roasted color. Not black. Subtle chocolate and burnt grain taste. Nice thick head that lingered a while. Mine came from a bottle.
Not bad.  Usually what I end up with when wanting a dark non-stout beer from my local grocer.  Nothing world-class, but it’s decent for what it is.

Poured a medium brown with a offwhite head. Aroma was light malt with german hop aroma and some skunk.  Flavor was light toasted malt, german hops and a bit of skunk.. Light to medium mouthfeel with good carbonation.

This beer pours a dark, almost black amber with a small tan head.  It smells of dark roasted chocolate.  It has a dark roast coffee/chocolate flavor that is not very complex.  Not a bad beer but I’ve had better.  Cheers!
On tap.  Surprised at the overall quality, expected Beck’s plus, got a bit more.  Very smoothe.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with an average creamy light brown head that was lasting and produced light lacing. Roasted harsh malt aroma. Medium body with a thin texture. Light bitter sweet flavor with an average finish.
A good beer that rivals the dark beer that becks has out, it is a good solid beer that rivals other dark beers of the same genre, you won’t be disappointed with him!

Poured a dark ruby with a small off-white head.  Aroma is light chocolate and caramel with some german hops.  Flavor is very thin german hops; the malt has very little presence.  Thin flavor and body.

Bottle.  Pours dark nut brown with a small fizzy light tan rocky film.  Sour yeast (sweat) and medium roasted caramel malt (meal) aroma with nutty notes.  Sour and bitter yeast malt flavor, that is both dry and chalky.  Medium bodied with lively carbonation.
I found this beer to be quite bitter.  It was also very smooth and drinkable.  For the most part, though, the bitterness was too much to overcome.

Hmmm. There’s really nothing to this stuff. I was expecting perhaps a richer version of Beck’s and it really wasn’t much different, aside from a bit of toasted malt. Watery and not what I’d describe as a dunkel. I’ll pass next time.

12 oz bottle consumed on vacation in Myrtle Beach SC at Murphy’s law.  Pours brown with a tan head.  Aroma is of light chocolate, caramel, and a bit of german hops.  Flavor is about the same.  Palate is watery and very light.  Decent but I probably won’t drink it again.

Bottle.  Poured a reddish brown with tan head.  Aroma was mostly malty.  It was a little thin and watery on the palate.  The flavor was mostly malt with a little hint of sweetness, not very complex though.  A disappointment after enjoying a couple Spaten Optimators, but I didn’t think it was too terrible.

Not so good.  The red colouring is nice, but that’s where anything acceptable ends.  Bitter, not in a "Mmm hops" way, but rather a "what died and fell into the vat while brewing?" aftertaste. I couldn’t smell anything recognizable.  Not completely horrible, but not worth the price.

This was a weak version of a dark ;ager.  Skunky from being an old bottle. Good Malt flavor and the hops are very lightly present. Light struck.  Low to no flavor this was a weak beer.  Becks needs to refine there brewing.

Proof positive that Germans can make crap just as well as anyone else can. Sampled on draft this beer poured a black color with a small white head. The aroma is faint sour malts and nothing else. The flavor is almost nonexistent. Some light sour tangy vague "flavor" I guess. No significant maltiness. No hops whatsoever. Fairly tasteless but at least not disgusting.

Bottle. Meidum copper color with quickly diminishing head. Aromas of candylike caramel, apples, brown sugar, and that skunkiness of German macros. Not a bad beer, but it doesn’t live up to its appearance. Body is too light and fizzy, unable to support the  otherwise pleasing sweet malt and also allowing that skunkiness to shine through in all its wierdness. Reminds me a lot of Yuengling Lager, which is half the price.

bottle. Pours a nice sturdy red with a fine, lasting frothy head.  Good beer to look at, not to smell or taste. The stench is of skunk and wet hay bales. The flavor is oddly alcoholy, like rubbing alcohol smells, and pretty dry. There are some mild plum notes in there, it’s really artificial tasting and reminds me of bad sour candy.

Deep brown, light tan creamy head.  Nose held notes of nutty caramel, and cola, with underlying notes of chocolate and coffee.  Flavor seemed more of the same with a light roasty, nutty, chocolate, coffee and cola mix.  Super light bittering in the end  rounds out the almost artificial flavoring.  Light bodied, light carbonation, soft roasted finish.  For free try it, but please don’t waste money on this....
For a session beer, this isn’t half bad.  Pours ruby red with a thin tan head that doesn’t stick around very long.  Smells of caramel.  Taste is slightly bitter, but pretty non-descript.

[bottle] Pours a dark brown with a small, fizzy head. From the beginning, this seemed bad to me- the aroma is of strong skunk/alcohol, and the tastes are not far from the aroma. I think this was worth the try, but I am not impressed.

Despite Beck’s dirty dirty lies, there is nothing robust about the flavor.  This is a dark light beer, and at best a light dark beer.   If you understand that, I will let you marry my sister...but only because she is old and ugly and tastes like Anheuser World Select.
All in all, try this out, but don’t expect anything.  If you want a watery, overcarbonated beer, but want to look cool by drinking a dark beer, this is it.

Better than I expected.  Not a bad watery dark kind of beer.  It has a little more flavor than the Beck’s-with-food-coloring that I expected.  It has no notable hops going on at all, and the malt isn’t anything to write home about, but it’s not a bad light dark beer.  Light referring to texture and flavor.  Give it a shot when your hopes aren’t too high and you might be slightly pleasantly surprised (whereas if you bought Anheurser World Select, you would be disappointed no matter how low your expectations were).

The guy who hates dark beer likes it.  What does that tell you?
A dark brown color with an off white head.  Has verry little aroma.  Some malthy weetness and a smooth finish.
This beer is good.It has a nice flavor of hops, malt, and some sweetness.  The beer has a very nice color, and a nice head.
good beer! ok taste, one of few darks I’ll drink... highly recomended, go out and try it
preferable to regular becks but  not worth the premium price.  being "dark" this is sweeter with slightly more body and character than the regular.

This one tasted alright, although there was something extraordinarily "regular" about it...it tasted controlled, mass-produced.  Slight roasted flavour, some hops.  Very balanced.  Strong metallic aftertaste, especially when getting to the end of the bottle, but this metallic quality is not altogether unpleasant.  Drinking this brew conjures up image of metal, stone, and electronics.
Bottle-Just didn’t like it.  Horrible aroma.  I didn’t get the point of it being dark--didn’t like it--didn’t finish it.

Similar to the regular Becks. The exceptions include the sweeter aroma and taste and the slightly toasty flavor. The aroma has some grassy hops but otherwise nothing special. Appearance is chocolate brown and the head disappears quickly to nothing. The palate is on the weak side and the aftertaste is faintly grassy like the smell.
Okay, smells like regualr becks or maybe St. Pauli Girl, which is not good. This is much better than their regular or light, but nothing special. A simple, adequate dark.

The bottle poured a mahogany red beer with a frothy off-white head that didn’t last and left no lacing on the glass. There was a distinct roast malt aroma predominating with notes of coffee. The body was thin and watery with lively carbonation and a clean dry texture. The flavor starts off with a slight burnt roasted malt flavor that matures in the middle to hop bitterness. The finish is long and somewhat bitter around the edges with roast malt dominating.

24 oz. Bottle: Dark brown color with a light brown head.  It has a metallic aroma which I didn’t enjoy.  Neither hops nor malts stood out which makes it an easy dark beer for people who like Coors Light!  Body seems thin with a slight biiter and watery aftertaste.  At first, I thought it might have something going for it, but not enough for me to try again.  Maybe, this tastes so bad since my last one was the 100% Ayinger Celebrator.  I don’t know . . . but Beck’s must be the Budweiser of Germany.
pours dark brown, small head the smell had some skunkiness to it followed by spice and roasted malts, decent taste , this beer is drinkable.
Poured dark brown with very little aroma.  Slightly bitter, but not a great flavor.

Poured a ruby brown with a thin cap of head. The nose started a little skunky then turned into caramel, pumpernickle and prunes. The taste started with sweet caramel, then dark fruits. The end had a medium hop bite and finished bready. Not bad, but nothing to go out of your way for. Back in the 80’s this was one of my first trips out of the land of the Macros.

Bottle.Dark brown with a white head that contrasted nicely with the brown color of the beer. Smells like slightly burned wheat toast and dark brown sugar. Flavor is roasted grains, bread and molasses. Medium bodied with decent carbonation.
Clear, ruby red w/ a frothy cream colored head. Sharp and malty German lager aroma. Remarkably slim flavor and watery body. Barely beyond the regular Beck’s. Truely uninspired.

A nice looking dark brown, adequate carbonation, big fluffy head. Nose is a bit tinny with sufficient hops. A little skunked from the green bottle, but not too bad. A little dusty as well. Now, let’s give her a taste, shall we? Quite malty, sweet, with a decent enough hop presence. Finish is quite clean, though. This is actually a decent beer! Smooth and sessionable, not too expensive for an import. Still, not a favorite, but doable.
not too bad.  had a taste of roasted expresso beans.  went down very smooth.  doesn’t taste as dark as it looks
Roasted flavor yet thin.  Bitter finish.  Average beer in this style.  Try Lakefront Eastside Dark for a superior Dunkel.
not much to go on.  It taste like a macro attempt at a stout but it really had no distinct flavor outside of burned malt.  it wasn’t horrible by any mean just really plain.

If you’re like me, you hate the original becks.  But don’t be afraid of this one.  Brown color and light malt scent.  This tastes like warsteiner dunkel but not as syrupy and full bodied.  It is crisp and refreshing.  very good.

from the bottle . poured brown with off white head. aroma, malts , barley, malts. flavor, malts, caramel, corn, I use to like this beer in my younger days when I thought that drinking a becks was cool.
Marginally better than regular Becks.  Aroma doesn’t have the skunk of regular becks and has some nice malt tones.  Flavor of lightly roasted barley, but overall pretty thin in the flavor and palate.
I was very impressed with Becks Dark, I have always liked Becks to begin with, very dark beer, smooth, great aftertaste, a nice sipping beer
Bottled.  Pours dark, with no head.  Aroma hot water bottle, cola syrup, and not much else.  Sorry excuse for a dunkel.  No thanks.

(bottle) Pours weak brown like watered-down coffee.  Dark brownish red color in glass.  Head is small, frothy, and diminishes before I have a chance to note its color.  Aroma is wake overall, but smells moderately malty, and slightly like bread.  Bready in taste too, with a light bitterness initially.  I’ve tasted worse beers before, but at least they had a unique and definitive taste.  Somewhat watery on the palate (lacking thicknes for a dark beer), with a metallic finish.  Overall, the self-acclaimed ’Number 1 Imported Beer From Germany’ doesn’t bring much to the table.
perhaps a little better than the regular becks but thats not saying a whole lot.   not a great deal of depth.

poured dark brown not opeque but dark with little head that didn’t stay around long.  Aroma carmelly, not at overpowering smell at all.  definately taste the roasted barley and a little sweet .  My question is what  the hell do they put it a green bottle.  Why do they put any beer in a green or clear bottle, for that matter.  Guess fashoinable looking beer bottles is more important than perserving the beer itself.
(Bottle)  Pours a dark mahogany body with small off-white head.  Malty aroma with some caramel.  Malt, somewhat sweet flavor.  Mild bitterness in the finish.
Some nice depth, but not overpowering.  It is a good beer and a nice alternative to the major USA options, but not something to return to often.

Poured very dark, small fizzy head that diminished quickly. Has a light yeasty aroma. Taste is raw and yeasty. Not really pleasant. It’s funny, when I started drinking beer, Beck’s dark was a real treat. Now I feel it’s just a mediocre beer just one step up above macro american brews.
Caramelly, but not nearly dynamic enough beyond that to grab my interest.  Mouthfeel is balanced with this sweet maltiness.  All with no surprises.  Zero aroma, really.

Grainy molasses nose. This looks exactly like the glass of Pepsi on the table next to it. There is barely a difference between the two. Toaste malt tastes with subtle toffee tones. Sugary and lacking bitter. Thin, watery and fizzy. Not so thrilled from this overall.

Looks good in the glass, though the head is small, light, and disappears quickly. Like regular Beck’s, this is pretty mild for its style, but good and very drinkable. Uneducated people expect it to be much sweeter with a much hoppier, bitter finish, but it is rather smooth, and perhaps even uneventful too drink. Not exciting, but tasty.

Looks nice in the glass, dark amber body with a small brown head.  Aroma is pretty skunky, I’d say this has been on the shelf for a while.  Flavor is bitter and skunky like most midrange import lagers, but there is a lot more body from the darker malts.  Not a bad drink.

Gotta be in the US to drink that from a nearby  town - this regional system in 
Germany is plain stupid. Nice mahagony color, medium malt and clay taste and nose.

Dark brown, but easily transparent in color with an off white head that is quite sudsy (larger bubbles).  Not a bad flavor, or good for that matter, slightly malty with some hops coming through in the end.  Weakly balanced I guess.  Little to no finish, the mouth forgets this beer quickly.

Bottle. Small head that mostly diminished, fair lacing, fine-small sized bubbles, carbonated, and a reddish brown hue. Malty, skunky aroma. Sweet, bitter, malty flavor with a little bit of a lingering aftertaste. The mouthfeel was smooth, watery and thin. Light body. Not impressed.

Super-dark garnet/brown, large but very quickly dissipating frothy, light charcoal head.  Aroma sweet and malty; very light caramel.  Flavor is dark and somewhat malty but strangely hoppy; way too much alcohol presence for 4.8% abv.  Very thin and lightly sticky.  Not horrible for a macro but far from great.

I found this to be an all around appetizing beer.  Poured a dark brown with some white head that quickly dissapates...kinda looks like a Coke.  Aroma is sweet and malty and the flavor is nice and sweet as well.  A little watery but it balances out the beer well in my opinion.  Overall, Id buy it again.
skunktastic.  thin, watery, no real flavor.  metallic aftertaste.  not impressed.  kind of like a more expensive bud light
Bottle. Is this cola? No, because cola doesn’t smell like skunk. Thin, slightly sweet, nearly tasteless, dry finish. Metallic. Yuck.
Pours brown with almost no head. Aroma is slightly caramel. Flavor is very mild. Litte character, almost no hop bitterness. Slight malt flavor. Watery mouthfeel.

Deep mahogany in colour.  Aroma was slightly sweet, some malt - mainly caramel.  Light flavour, some caramel sweetness, bready.  Fairly average and simple.  Lightish body.  Finishes with a light bitterness.

Poured a dark brown with a very small and fleeting tan head.  The aroma was of roasted malts, caramel, and mildly hoppy.  Flavor was malty sweetness upfront (caramel), hoppy bitterness in the middle, and finished with a nice dry coffe essence.  Not bad.

Thinner than I was expecting.  Pours a deep brown - almost black molasses - color - but remember the thin viscocity.  Could have been a little stronger and bolder.  Slightly nutty and chocolatey, but not well pronounced.
bottle.  aroma was a little weak and the flavor was of light malt.  However I certainly wouldn’t call this beer robust.  an OK dunkel but nothing special.
Bottle.  Well, it does have a little bit of malt aroma and taste with a sickly sweet finish.  Dunkel?  No.  Sweetened mud?  Yup.
poured ah, dark? This smelled of malts but nothing great. Tasted ok, better then reg. Becks. but nothing to loss your head about.

Becks Dark.  This was one of my transition beers.  The bridge from the Schaefer/Piels/Ballantine/Rheingold to today’s microbreweries.  Becks.  Good German beer.  NOT.  A dark brown with an accommodating off-white head, the aroma was weak and smokey, some sweetness, malty.  Pretty good body to it.  The taste was better than any BMC beer but is probably the BMC of Germany.
Color is extremely dark, obviously, bitter sweet flavor... aroma isn’t anything really special.  I don’t know if i’ll buy this beer again, it wasn’t average by any means, but i’ve had better.
bottl form local bodega,brown color nice head, aroma is of sweet carmel,metal.thin body. really lackin in any storng flavors. ok not very good

Bottle.  DMS, chocolate metallic malty aroma.  Faint DMS, though.  Mahogany dark brown transparent color with a frothy light tan head.  Flavor is malty with some DMS notes, but minimal.  Chocolate roasted notes in the finish.  Decent...not bad for what it is.
Dark brown color with a head.  Not to impressed with this brew.  Kinda burnt flavor.  Had better.

beer had a dark pour w/ a very lite soap bubbly head.. the aroma was very very light in my opinon and contained nothing of substance.  it had some good carbonation on the toungue but it was a little thin and dry.  I thought hte flavor was pretty decent with a little malt to it but mostly an light easy to drink flavor.  Nothing jumped out at me from this beer but it simply just wasn’t bad.. I probably wouldn’t by it but I would drink it again.
This seems like the illegitimate nephew of Guinness.  A watered down version--perhaps a ripoff.  Not as good as Becks Octoberfest.  Better than regular Becks.

Has the texture something like an extra stout, but watered down.  Black cherry finish to the taste.  Aroma is heavy on the nose, but hard to make out.  Drank the day after the Red Sox won the 2004 World Series... and beer tastes just as sweet.

I have always liked Becks Dark.  Good looking dark beer.  Cant say the same for the lager or oktoberfest, but the dark has a nice medium bodied flavor that I like.  Consistent and never disappoints me.   I like to keep a few in the fridge, and you can buy this beer at almost any grocery in this area for about $7 a six.  So much better that the average swill on the grocery shelf.  ...06/01/2005...  been a while since I had this with all the stouts and strong ales and such, but this was on sale at the local bottle shop and I was feeling nostalgic so I picked up a sixer for $6.    No, Becks Dark will not rock your world, but is a good tasting brew that is a great every day beer.  A decent German dunkel, always satisfying.  A little better on tap, but just fine in the bottle.
Dark amber with a little bit of a head.  has a bit of a bitter taste to it (which becks is know for).  has been becoming pretty popular lately.  Only the slightest of roasted flavor.

We decided to venture out after hurricane Ivan passed and went to the local fried seafood joint.  This was their only import available.  Don’t even ask what their domestic selections were......Mich Ultra was the headliner....’nuff said.  This crap tasted as "good" as regular Becks, except darker and marginally sweeter. Appearance is decent enough, with a weak and short-lived head. Aroma is of cheap malts, borderline skunk juice. Has no body. Flavor is weak and almost non-existent save for a small tinge of malt. Finish is nonexistent.  I learned a little German along the way I think.  Not only is "Becks" German for beer, it’s also German for "over priced, over rated swill".  Thank God my father-in-law ate the bill on this one.

This is available in a lot of pizza joints in the area, which is why I have it on occassion.  Good looking golden brown in the glass, there’s very little to smell.  The taste is more akin to an amber lager, the sweetish aftertaste giving the only hint that it’s a dunkel.  Still, it’s better than the lights that are the alternative in those joints.

24 oz. bottle.  Almost no nose, but it looks good in a glass. Head does not last long, with only traces of lace.  High turnover for this in my local market, so have had few skunked ones. Negligible body, and though roasted flavor does not last, it’s better than the regular lager. Better choice  than a macro-brew for Sunday football.
Dark amber/brown beer with a medium tan head. Weak in the aroma, some sweet malt and fruit. Roasted malt and toffee in the flavor. Surprisingly tasty but thin of course. Sparkling.

Pours with a one-finger off-white head that leaves no lace.  Deep, clear amber color.  Light bodied and very light carbonation.  Skunky nose.  Starts with a tinny, metallic, skunky taste (what is it with the green bottles??) and has a watery finish.  $1.55 for a 12oz. bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.
A little darker looking than I thought. Good roast flavors. Solid malt character in a light easy drinking beer.

I enjoy this far more than the lager.  In recent years it has much less of a presence in restaurants than in the pre-micro brew days.  Too bad as it is pretty drinkable.  But I’ll still take a majority of micros..........
like this one better than the regular one, aroma is slightly roasty, dark hue, didn’t like the sweet aftertaste.  its drinkable, nothing to rave about though.

Deep dark brown with an off white head.  Looks good.  A metallic aroma with a little alcohol, and roasted malt.  The flavor is a little bland with a hop bite up front.  Some sweetness is prevalent but aftertaste is bad.  It is overall palatable, not bad but not good either.
Pretty good beer.  A little darker than a regular beck’s, but nothing special.  Has a little bit of an aftertaste.

Color of cola with a small tan head. Light
roasted malt aroma. Mild malt flavor. 
Somewhat bland but drinkable.
On draft at Jet Rock in the Philly Airport - in between a pint of Newkie Brown and a pint of Guiness:  full bodied, slightly sweet, slight roasted dark lager.  Surprisingly good.

[12 oz. bottle] Poured a clear brown color with not much of a head. Very lightly toasted malt aroma with a touch of hops. Crisp malt taste with a very slight hint of hops at the end. Very thin though, and could have used a bit more bite to it.

cola brown with a nice head but it didnt last,,slight toasty aroma with hoppy finish, very carbonated at the pour.
not bad at all but a little bland for a darky.
Cola brown, thin tan head. Faint toasty aroma. Slightly sweet, mellow hoppy finish, with some mild coffee flavors.
An average dark, not anything spectacular but enjoyable.  There are many better German Dunkels out there, however.

Bottled, served with lime.  This beer I did not appreciate much and lime couldn’t help it.  This reminded me of corona, only brown; somewhat reminiscent of normal Beck’s lager, but this beer I did not enjoy.
A dark brown appearance with a moderate head. The aroma is caramel and chocolate. The flavor is chocolate and grapes. This has a pretty weak palate but I dont mind drinking it. Not a bad pick up.

A nice try from this big brewery to make a Dunkel. Off course not as good as the smaller German dunkel beers but if you can choose between this and other dunkels from big comercial breweries I would choose this one.
Dark Coloring.  Not a terrible Dark..the only Beck’s I would consider drinking.
A good, Solid, dark beer, My wife loves it for breadmaking! Its not too complex, Its a basic dark beer. I do prefer regular Beck’s Lager though! But its good!
Dark brown pour, small light tan head. Sweet malty nose, very carbonated body. Better than regular Becks.
Bottle - Dark brown in color with a creamy light tan head.  Aroma is of malt and caramel with a hint of skunkiness.  Hint of metallic aftertaste.  Better than the regular Becks.
A very good beer. One I sip on before dinner. Dark brown with a nice cream head.  Has a great malty flavor.
A waitress brought this to my table by accident when I ordered a normal Becks.  i didn’t complain because I really enjoyed it.  I ended up ordering a second.  Quickly went on my list of top beers.

Not a staple in my fridge, but it was on sale. Pours almost-brown copper, clear, happily bubbling into a creamy inch-high head. Weak nose; I barely catch whiffs of lager malt, some sweetness, weak coffee, and very faint zesty grassy hop. Smooth, mellow malt flavor is supported by a chocolate/cola/tootsy roll flavor, ending with a fairly solid but fleeting hop bitterness. An elusive honey character emerges as the beer warms. Nicely ragged sheets of lace pursue the liquid surface in superslow motion. A little less than medium-bodied, but silky on the tongue. Lingering, mildly bitter aftertaste. Pretty mainstream.

In the bottle. Dark brown in color. Very carbonated with big bubbles. While it has a limited malty aroma, there is a decent malt flavor in an otherwise pretty light bodied beer. Roasted sweetness comes out at the end of the beer. As with Heinekin Dark, this is a beer that I like to put peanuts into the bottle. I’m not sure why.

Beck’s dark, it has a dark cola like body, when i poured it from a bottle the head did not hold very long. It has a roasted aroma, light but it was pleasing. the taste was sharp, it tasted like a cola, very sweet aftertaste in the back of the tounge, has a fizz on the toungue too. Smooth on the swallow too. It lacks an alcohol taste, but it was good.
Dark makes everything better.  As with the regualar Becks, you really don’t get much more out of the pour, so it makes good for traveling.
aroma is mostly of hops; dark brown with a very small head; definite coffee taste, especially in the finish; watery feel

Had this one straight from the bottle at a local tavern. Not much aroma to speak of, color was dark caramel. Taste was pleasant, but not as rich as I had hoped. Was a little weird on the palate: had almost a chewy feel in the aftertaste. Overall a decent beer, but not great.

bottled: at the barbeque as well (see becks rate) this poured into my glass just like coca cola. tan bubbly head and brown and clear with tingly bubbles into the nares. smell of skunk again, dont really get this. is this what they are looking for?? tastes the same as the light, maybe slight more caramel flavor,,,maybe. i like ostegolectric's rate, go read that one.

Deep brown appearance, big foamy head and some spotty lacing. Aroma.. aroma.. not really there. Smells a bit like a penny. Some malts, nothing defining though. Flavor is bad. Very acidic and metallic. Bleh.

Best beer I've drank yet.  This and the other one that it tastes like.  The Other white beck.  You know, that one beer with the green bottle and the label and the cap and shit.  I like that one.  E.L.O is holdin iit down what is you doin dawg.  I had this beer in prison once.  Did I tell you about my time in prison?

Pours a cola-colored brown, small head rests atop. Smells metallic, almost like blood.  That's kinda sick.  Flavor tastes a whole lot like regular becks, with a hint of malts in there.  All in all, skunky and watery.
I had this after a glass of kirin ichiban. This tasted like one of the best beers ever. It had a skunky smell but didnt taste too bad.

Somewhat skunky smell (didn't care for).  Taste made-up of aroma.  Good flavor, midly bitter (would linger a bit to long).  Overall a rather tasty brew; would recommend (as long as you hold your breath).

I liked this beer. The aroma was not spectacular, but the rest was pretty good. If compared to Heineken Dark or regular Becks, I think this a better, less-offensive brew. It tastes pretty good and although mass-produced, is still enjoyable. My overall impression is positive.

Beautiful dark amber with a lingering, pond-scummy-ish head (in a good way!).  Very light in the flavor department with traces of bitterness that race across the tongue and then linger for a while, maybe to watch some tv or something.  Nice refreshing-ness to it, but it's ok.
Not really too bad. sweet, a lil skunky and weak, but has redeemable points although i cant think of any off the top of my head.

Light brown in color with a small off-white head which quickly diminishes to a lacing around the rim. Skunky hop aroma.Skunky hop flavor with mild roasted malt,mildly bitter with a moderate lingering finish.
Sweet and smooth with a hint of hop aftertaste. Not a very bold beer. This brew is not worth the required 75 characters.

This was my favorite beer for a long time. I have since moved on to a new style (IPA). But I still have fond memories of looking forward to the motor oil. Still a very good stop gap beer when no other truly exotic brews are available. This may be the Michelob of German beers, but it serves the purpose in a pinch.

The bottle that I got was not skunked at all which surprised me.  This had a smoky, crisp malt flavor and some subtle hops.  I thought it was fairly enjoyable.  It had a dark brown color and a fresh taste.  Not a beer that I would go out of my way to buy, but not bad.
Dark, just like the label says.  But making the beer dark didn't add any flavor.  This reminded me of St. Pauli Girl pilsner, but not as good.
It's a little better than regular beck's but still has an unpleasent and almost disgusting aftertaste..get it right becks or get out.
Brown in color, with a quickly diminishing head. The smell is the typical German beer smell. Not much roasted flavor, but overall a decent drinkable beer.
It is like the original only dark. Certainly one that you would drink if thats all there was but would not buy.
Better than the regular, but that's not saying too much. Some decent roasted malt flavor to go along with the skunk.

I wonder what the marketing budget is for this? If I drink it will it increase my desirability? With women that have sculpted breasts and designer smiles? Will it give me that je ne sais quoi I have yearned for so long?  This is so good that it's like the regular, only, get this, it's DARK!

on the watery side, has a fairly typical 'dark beer' taste (suppose thats why it's a dunkel ;) ) nothing about this beer really stands out, but alot of bars that generally only carry crap (bud, etc) often carry becks, and i'll take becks over the crap anyday.

Looks like root beer with a smaller head. Dark down.

Has a funky grass smell, unlike most grassy smells of beers.

Not bad taste, but not so great either. Has hints of a coffee, but it's just barely there, instead going for the tangy grassy taste mostly.

It's drinkable, and I have a feeling this would be a good session beer, as it goes down nice and smooth. Just wish it was a little better.
Okay I've never had regular Beck's. This stuff is pretty good, surely better than the other more common dunkel /American dark, Heineken.
A little roasty/sour flavour, but in a pinch I would go to regular Beck, since that has a little bit better hops flavour.   Borderline.

Pretty typical dark beer.  There is nothing outstanding about it.  It taste like regular becks, only its dark, if i had to guess i would say roasted malt gives it the color, as there are hints of it in the flavor
Chestnut color with an off white head. Mild sweet dark malt aroma. Light caramel flavors and somewhat watery feel. Light touch of bitterness in the finish. Somewhat typical dark macro.

Draft: Mohagany color with a thin tan head.  Mild Europena hoppy aroma with a touch of roasted malt.  Bittersweet Saaz hop flavor. Dry carbonated fizzy finish.  A good example of a macro-brewed dunkel.
Medium to full bodied.  Sweet taste with lingering after taste.  Deep color, nearly black.  Good head.  A step below a dunkel in taste.
quite mild overall, darker with decent lacing on the glass. somewhat skunky, kind or reminded me of bass. but overall mild and unimpressive
Pours black with a nice head. Typical German dark lager flavor with some roasted malt overtones.

TheDM and Hotstuff vacation brew 70.  This bottled brew was  sampled at the Orlando Ale House in Orlando Florida.  This brew poured a medium head of foamy mostly diminishing fine to medium sized light brown colored bubbles that left behind a transparent uncarbonated brown colored body.  The aroma was non-existent or mildly malted at best and the mouth feel was smooth, slightly tingly and soon fades in the finish.  It had a mild brown malt and a slight hop flavor.  Very thin and still an insult to good German beer!

I don't have any formal notes, but here's what I remember...Thin for the style and a little less sweet than I was expecting.  Grainy to a degree, not the solid, round maltiness I usually find in a dunkel.  Carbonation interferred with the mouthfeel.  The bottom line is: at least they used a brown bottle for this one.
Hmm, doesn't really appal me or appeal to me.  Slightly malty, slightly skunky.  Don't think I'd buy a 6 pack of this when I wanted to enjoy a great brew, but it'll suffice.
Very, very brown. Malty, kind of. Nothing bad about this but it really doesn't taste like a lot of anything to me. Selah.
Brown in color. Sweet in smell. Sweet and bitter in taste. Decent mixture of malts and hops. This is a decent beer.

Brownish/red, with some lighter yellow tinges.  Clear and bubbly, decent white head on it. Light smell of grains and maybe a whiff of malt.  Crisp, mildly sweet, with a lightly sour lager finish.  Definitely a good easy drink, just nothing challenging about this beer. Smooth, even, balanced surprisingly, little bit of spiciness and light caramel malt.  Probably takes alot more crap than it deserves.
Fairly good. Nothing too complex as it has small amounts of hops and barley flavor. Looks good in a glass, though.
I really like this beer. It is pretty heavy but has a good strong taste. Very good dark beer.

Has a bit of a bitter/astringent taste to it, and a "skunky" smell. It's an all right dark wheat brew, not that good, much better with food than by itself, I think. I speculate this would be a good beer to drink in mass quantities.
very nice brew for $1.99 i would take this over a steel reserve anyday.goes down really smooth and tickles the palate oh so lightly.again great brew for the price.

This was my first dark beer and it opened my eyes to what beer could be (hey - in 1986 it was hard to find the good stuff).  Anyway, it doesn't hold up now that my palatte has improved, but I still love the memory.

Bought in the 24 oz green bottle..the famed Beck"s crest apon the label..will this be the "Key" to my taste buds :-)?
This is actually quite a gorgeous looking beer when poured into a glass.. nice dark mahogany brown colour..with a good sized frothy off white head which lingers well..very good!
Nice aroma of roasted malts and chocolate( dark) greets my senses....little black coffee to..also good.
Taste is very bland in comparison to the aroma and the appearance quite subdued hops and almost no toasted malts as a i had expected from the aroma..what went wrong?..but its not offensive.
pretty average for this style on the tongue, though not nearly as harsh as i find the regular Beck,s.
All in all a pretty drinkabkle beer which could be a lot better if they spiced up the taste a bit..come on Beck's take a chance!

It was the closest thing to real beer they had at a recent wedding.  This really is not so bad, as much as I dislike the brewery.  It had a very nice head and a decent body, and while the flavor was not terribly complex, it was focused and even tasty.  It will certainly do in a pinch.

Starts out ok but fades to commercial A-
B like aftertaste. Better than average but not by much.
ugh, not so good.  ive really never had a good becks anything...............

Quite average.  If I hadn't seen with my eyes that this was a dark beer, I wouldn't have known.  Couldn't detect the sweetness I was expecting, which wasn't all bad.  Floral, spicy hops, with a bit of bitterness.  Very, very faint roasty flavor.  Not great by any means, but beat the crap out of the Heine that I tried recently.
Better than Beck's Regular. Its got a dark rustric taste that tingles the senses.
Hey better than Becks regular, but still not a better beer from Germany. Definitely no real character to the beer. Compare to Heineken Dark & St Pauli Girl Dark.
Just not very impressive. Somewhat sweet and malty, but nothing very pleasant really happens after that. Thin and boring.

Clearn dark brown with some ruby in the edges.  A very light assemblence of nutty malt in the nose.  The flavours were fine, roasted nuts and a bit of chocolate, but there was no depth.  Would drink again if placed in front of me.

Poured a beautiful, clear dark, reddish-brown color with a luscious, medium-sized off-white head.  Unfortunately the pour was the highlight of this beer.  Light malty, nutty aroma.  Initial roasted malt flavor quickly gives way to a very objectionable bitter, metallic taste.  Light body with light carbonation.
Clear red-amber with a filmy off-white head. Slightly stale aroma of toasted malts and light hops. Some fruit and malt flavor followed by a bitter aftertaste of turpentine. Mostly flat, oily palate.
For a dark beer, Becks is surprisingly mild.  The sweet aftertaste was there as advertised.  I liked its flavor but expected more from a dark beer.

This one pours a dark, clear, ruby red color with a small, off-white, fizzy head. The aroma is malty sweet with a touch of caramel. It has a light body with moderate carbonation and slightly watery mouthfeel. The flavor is malty sweet up front. The finish is a little thin but has some decent sweet malt notes. Definitely not a top class dunkel, but not bad either. I would drink this one again.
Becks Dark is a tad watery for a dark, and its flavor is pretty simplistic, but it still beats the lemmings out of most American dunkels.

Dark amber/brown, not much head though. Some bitterness and some traces of malt. A tad thin. There was some potential with this one but it just needs a little more kick. Better than the original Beck's.
Thinner than some other darker beers I'm used to. If you close your eyes, you can almost taste hints of regular Becks.
Had this on tap.Dark amber in color.kind of woodsy, spicy notes.I like the bottle version better.
Not a bad beer, but I prefer Beck's original more.  The taste was a little harsh but still a decent beer.

This beer pours a dark amber - actually, it's more like a watered down dark beer more than a dark amber.  There is little head and no lacing on the glass.  The aroma is almost non-existant.  The little bit of aroma is slightly malty.  The taste is actually pretty smooth, but a little watered down.  I found this beer quite enjoyable even though it's not too interesting.  The aftertaste is a little dry, but good.  Recommended.

good balance - did have some nice flavor and notable bitterness but was still light and easy to drink.  a little more malt and body would be nice though.  too lager-esque; like michelob's amberbock or something.
Mmmm, free beer at the casino, this was their best offering. It was malty with a musky hop taste. slightly dry and bitter with a refreshing finish.
Becks dark is a clean little dunkle with a light  roasty character.  It has a nice nutty flavour and is a little sweet on the finish without being unpleasant
A decent beer that looks nice and tastes decent. I thought I smelled some "wet dog hair" in there, but it passes the flavor test. Is somewhat on the bitter side.
Pours well with a nice head, pleasant aroma, lost its head rather quickly. I have to agree with bigbadbeer as to the bitter/sweet taste and somewhat bitter aftertaste.

Good color and some head, some lacing, medium-bodied. Malty and hint of smoke and nuts. Bitter with some sweet tones, but unbalanced. Bitter aftertaste. Better than Becks pils but still not a high quality brew.
Tasted of old, watered-down, grandpa coffee.  Took one sip and dumped the rest out.
Light, smooth and watery. Slightly sweet, reminiscent of an Altbier. Head is pretty thin.

Small light tan head which dissipates quickly.  Initial aroma of skunkiness then that fades into a nice bittersweet chocolate and toffee.  Color is a nice dark cherry color with very little carbonation.  Flavor is of dark chocolate, coffee and VERY bitter.  Not a good bitter from an abundance of hops either.  Instead, a bitter from the imbalance of ingredients present.   One of the most bitter beers I have had.  Finish is bitter again and leaves a strange sensation of your mouth shriveling up due to the bitter, dry taste.  Not a very plesant finish.  Not recommended.

Really dark with a little lacing but not much head.  Taste of dark roasted malt, coffee, and toffee ... but still surprisingly thin in the mouth and surprisingly lacking intensity or complexity of flavor.  Sort of a mini-mini-stout.  Not bad as a mass market global beer from a giant factory, but no better than that.
Has a dark brown color with a good bit of carbonation and a light roasted malt smell.  Taste is also of roasted malts and finishes with a kind a sweet coffee/nut flavor.  Overall the best Becks.

Another in the taste test of Beck's beers. Poured out a rich brown color, with a fast fading head. No lace in the glass either. Smelled of malts, mostly chocolate and black patent. Aromas of stale coffee also. Not the best dark beer I've ever had, but also, not the worst. Had a strange aftertaste to it, like a coffee flavored ice cream or something. I won't be buying this again.

Maple syrup brown amber body with a head a tad too thick.  Rather skunked aroma, even after aeration though detectable malt sweetness.  Metallic semi-sweet taste with an ookey, unpleasant bitter, almost nutty quality.
A dark version of the regular. Nice color and aroma but really weak compared to most dark beers.

Bottle... Beautiful, crystal clear maple hue. Small, lightly-tanned fizzy head. Quickly and mostly diminishing. No lacing.
The nose is malty and yeasty with very small bursts of caramel and bread dough. A whisper of allspice. Moderately malty flavor up front with hints of caramel and honey. Very well-balanced on the backside with an excellent, lightly bitter and moderately astringent hop presence. Medium-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, crisp, clean finish with notes of caramel thrown in. Much better brew than I expected. Probably hadn’t had one for over ten years.
Not a bad flavor, but this beer is a wee bit thin.  Nice color and aroma, though.
This was just disgusting.  If you're really hard up for dark beer, get St. Pauli instead.

Bottle.  It was either this, Amstel Light or Heineken(Bud products not considered).  Decent looking color.  Little aroma and surprisingly thin for the color.  Slightly roasted flavor.  Decent for a macro, but much too thin.  Beck's should put more ingredients in this beer.

Nice light brown colour with a small tan head.  Not much aroma but something roasted pushes through.  Slightly skunky smell as well.  Flavour is slightly roasted notes and grains, like bread in some ways.  Finish is pleasant and easy.  A good beer but not much for flavour.

Light chestnut brown with a tan tight head.  Light nose, weak all over.  Hints of toasted/lightly roasted malts, flaked barley.  Some skunky funk as well.  Decent mouthfeel, real clean and a light pleasant finish with some corn in there.
Very dark, almost black. Small head. Faint aroma, but nice roast malt flavor. Decent body.

Very creamy, like stout, but with the subtle flavor of a good lager.  Awesome, long-lasting aftertaste.  However, it seems very inconsistent out of the bottle, which is an opaque green color.  I've had several, and the quality varies a great deal.
Stenchy, unappealing odour. Pours a very dark, opaque brown with a thin head. Palate is thin and watery. Slightly acidic, perhaps a bit of molasses. As the Germans would say, "shiza"

Looks like a good beer.  Very dark with a tinge where the light hits the glass.  Decent head with some staying power.  Smells like a pilsener.  Light nutty start, stronger chocolate malty finish.  Perhaps a little thin but I have to say I that the start was better than I expected.  After the first few mouthfulls the beer became almost boring and did not live up to it's initial impression.  Reminds me of of a Becks with some chocolate malt.
Skunky aroma, probably light-struck, but thats their fault for putting it in a green bottle.  Slightly sweet, caramel flavor.  Dry finish.  Nothing special, not particularly good.

A bit better than the original, though not the greatest dark around.  There are a lot better ones out there than this.

RE-RATE:  Since I apparently wasn’t feeling all that prolific in my first rating...

Pours a dark brown with a decent, but quickly disappearing head.  Nose is rather odd.  A bit like toasted bread with other yeasty notes, but I swear it also smelled of mustard (not yellow...something more substantive).  Flavors are ok, but thin.  Malt and caramel.
Well, better than some. Smelled skunky. Tasted Skunky. Dark amber. Lingering aftertaste. There was a nutty flavor.

Dark amber brown body with a thin head and some lace.  sour skunky aroma.  Slightly sweetmalty flavor with sour/bitter undertones and a sour slightly hoppy finish. Medium bodied with a touch of dryness.

This rating puts me atop the charts in the State of Minnesota. Dry roasted malt aroma. Avg. sized head; off-white. Dark, reddish brown. Average lasting head. Not much lace. Dry, almost smoky peaty flavor. Not bad. I'll bet this is quite good on tap in Munich. A pretty good session beer, but doesn't have the qualities of a great beer.
This German woman gives descent head and is dark in color.  Her most distinctive feature is her smell..I can smell her malt.  Her taste is too smooth...I like more bite.

I found this to be much tastier than the regular Beck's.  A dark, amber hue as it is poured, with a small frothy head.  I like it because it goes down very easily and has a nice malted nutty flavor at the end.
Better than the regular pilsner.  Not a bad beer............................
Dark ruby color very little head. Flavor is a little sweet and nutty........
Pretty much the equivalent of Heineken Dark. Cola-colored, small head, some malt in the aroma, less so in the taste. At any given time, it would be a tossup between this and the regular HeineBeck''s.

Very smooth beer that drinks easily, although it isn't as powerful as most dark beers.  I easily downed a 6 pack of this last night without hesitation.  Same texture as Sammy Smith's Oatmeal Stout (note:  texture, not taste), better than the original... Refreshing!

Hooray beer or something like that! Had this one with my pasta a few hours back...dark brown with minimal to no head..aroma''s of malt and that was about it. The taste was very bland...a little malt, a faint hint of darkness/chocolate...but very faint indeed. Very dry, rogue aftertaste...not a good pasta beer, and not a spectacular beer by itself either.
dark brown, fair head, sweet aroma. the finish has a little bite............
its another dark and of course i didnt like it...maybe one day ill find one i do like...
Brown in color.Has a faint malt nose, as opposed to regular Becks.Could stand a lot more malt. Gassy

Like regular Becks, except darker and marginally sweeter. Appearance is decent enough, with a passable but short-lived head. Aroma is of cheap beer/skunk. Has no body. Flavor is weak and almost non-existent save for a small tinge of malt. Finish is nil.
Most that i have had of this was skunked. First off because no one buys it. but the few times i got good bottles they were ok. so i guess i wont slaughter this one.

Green bottle = skunked.
It has a nice appearance but not much in the flavor dept. due to the skunkiness.
Pretty decent for a dunk, nice color,malty aroma with slight amount of chocolate in the taste with a good finish that didn''t bite to hard.well done

Very dark brown, foamy creamy head dissipates immediately.  Aroma a little skunky, a little malty, not very good.  Flavor has hints of chocolate and caramel, somewhat malty, but also thin and tasting of artificial carbonation.  Watery finish.  Not good.
Becks Dark is a good mix of the flavors of a green beer and the full palate of a dark beer.  It''s better than most green beers and still fills you up... but drink it before it''s old.

Stale odor, not as bad as the regular becks.
Tinge of roasty flavor, but not really all that 
good.  Below average for a dark beer.

They said I have to improve my ratings. Ok. The aroma of this beer is good. The appearance of this beer is good. The flavor of this beer is good. The palate of this beer is good. My overall impression is a positive one.

So there.
this has to be my least favorite when it comes too dark beer!  I''d only recommend drinking it when eating mac&cheese
Some toasted malt flavor. This tasted pretty much like regular golden lager (Beck's Lager I would suppose). The main difference being some additional sweet malts. Very pleasant, but nothing special.
some malts, not as much as the color led me to expect.  very little hop presence, except in the slightly dry finish.  some astringency.
Better than the Becks Pilsner.  More flavor and aroma was significantly better.  Dark brown color and medium bodied.  Not bad some malt and some hopps.  A good start but a little light in the finish.

Nothing special.  typical color with a becks regular type of flavor + some malts.  Thing about becks which still surprises me is how geared to the american market they are.  I lived in Bremen for five weeks this summer and the only becks sorts I saw were the regular and a new thing called Becks Gold.  Not to mention the St. Pauli girl line isn''t marketed at all for certain hamburg related reasons.  Anywho, nothing from the brewery is much spectacular but the tour is good.  However, I failed the taste test at the end to my everlasting shame.  I still say it was rigged.
Dark thick brown color - looks like syrup.  Fairly malty and sweet, but that''s about it.  Some caramel in the end, but fairly straightforward.
A decent dark brewed Dunkel. Dark in color, sweet in taste..................
Haven''t had this one in a while, but doesn''t seem much different from Becks.
All 12 ounces fit in the plastic mug served at the pizza joint, because there was no head. Dark color, but lacking any real malt flavors. Smooth and drinkable.
forgot i had one of these at a bar a few weeks ago-not bad, but nothing special-there are many beter dunkels out there-a leine''s creamy dark sounds good right about now ;)

A very nice German style dark beer. One of the better dark beers i have had rivaling Yuengling Porter. Had it with chinese food and then had a few too many more and god real sick. Dont let that steer you away from this great beer.
Pretty good brew hmya, just tryed it last night , didnt find it to have a harsh bitter finish as others seemingly have, but after a guiness u dont notice bitterness as well as u used to
I think I''m a bit too spoiled starting off with good beers and working my way backwards... this was not very good.  Over carbonated, bitter flavor.... but somehow still very bland.
This isn''t a bad beer. Pretty tasty with a heavy flavor....................
Good beer, slightly heavy taste with a bit of aftertaste....................
About all I can say is, pretty smooth taste - I like it.....................
Generally a boaring average beer. Didn''t seem much like any other dunkel I have tried, more like a maltier lager. Unimpressive.

Hmmm.  There''s really nothing to this stuff.  I was expecting perhaps a richer version of Beck''s and it really wasn''t much different, aside from a bit of toasted malt.  Watery and not what I''d describe as a dunkel.  I''ll pass next time.

Slight roastiness with hops and mild tang in aroma...Color a brown-amber with decent head--some lace...Flavor is mildly roasty with the characteristic Beck's hoppiness and tang, which does not quite mesh on balance...Body is decent with the addition of the darker malts...Overall, quite drinkable but unremarkable, especially for the import price...
This is way too pilsner-esque for a dark. Has a large head, but the smell alone is enough to make me never get nea one again.
